high.mackenzie.autumn.lang.compiler.typesystem.design

Interface IDeclaredType

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IAnnotatable, IElementType, IExpressionType, IReferenceType, IReturnType, IType, IVariableType
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    IAnnotationType, IClassType, IEnumType, IInterfaceType
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractDeclaredType, CustomDeclaredType, ReflectiveDeclaredType

    public interface IDeclaredType
extends IElementType, IReferenceType, IAnnotatable
    An instance of this interface is a type that can be placed in a class-file.

    • Method Detail

      • isAlreadyCompiled

        boolean isAlreadyCompiled()
        This method determines whether this type is already compiled.

        Types that are already compiled include types from shared libraries.

        Returns:
        true, if and only if, this type is already compiled.

      • getNamespace

        java.lang.String getNamespace()
        This method returns the name of the package that this type is declared within.

        Examples

        getName() getNamespace()
        java.lang.String java.lang
        java.util.List java.util

        Returns:
        the name of the package that this type is declared within.

      • getAnnotations

        java.util.List<IAnnotation> getAnnotations()
        This method returns the annotations that are directly applied to this entity.
        Specified by:
        getAnnotations in interface IAnnotatable
        Returns:
        an immutable list containing the annotations that are applied to this entity, or an empty immutable list, if no annotations are applied to this entity.

      • getModifiers

        int getModifiers()
        This method returns the modifiers that are applied to this type.
        Returns:
        the modifiers that modify this type.
        See Also:
        Modifier

      • getSuperclass

        IClassType getSuperclass()
        This method returns the direct superclass of this type.

        If this type is java.lang.Object then this method returns this.

        Returns:
        the direct superclass of this type.

      • getAllSuperclasses

        java.util.List<IClassType> getAllSuperclasses()
        This method returns all the superclasses of this type.

        The returned list is ordered from most-specific to most general.

        Returns:
        an immutable list containing all the superclasses of this type, or an empty immutable list, if no superclasses are present.

      • getSuperinterfaces

        java.util.Collection<IInterfaceType> getSuperinterfaces()
        This method returns the direct superinterfaces of this type.
        Returns:
        an immutable collection containing the direct superinterfaces of this type, or an empty immutable collection, if no superinterfaces are present.

      • getAllSuperinterfaces

        java.util.Collection<IInterfaceType> getAllSuperinterfaces()
        This method returns all the superinterfaces of this type.
        Returns:
        an immutable collection containing all the superinterfaces of this type, or an empty immutable collection, if no superinterfaces are present.

      • getFields

        java.util.Collection<IField> getFields()
        This method returns the fields that this type directly declares.

        If the type is an enumeration, the returned list includes the enum-constants in the enum.

        Returns:
        an immutable collection containing the directly declared fields in this type, or an empty immutable collection, if no fields are present.

      • getConstructors

        java.util.Collection<IConstructor> getConstructors()
        This method returns the constructors that this type directly declares.
        Returns:
        an immutable collection containing the constructors that this type directly declares, or an empty immutable collection, if no constructors are present.

      • getMethods

        java.util.Collection<IMethod> getMethods()
        This method returns the methods that this type directly declares.
        Returns:
        an immutable collection containing the directly declared methods in this type, or an empty immutable collection, if no methods are present.

      • getAllVisibleMethods

        java.util.Collection<IMethod> getAllVisibleMethods()
        This method returns all the explicit and implicit methods that this type declares.

        Inherited method are included in the returned list. Private methods are never inherited. Static methods are never inherited.

        Returns:
        an immutable collection containing all the methods that are declared in this type.

      • isAnnotationType

        boolean isAnnotationType()
        This method determines whether this object is really the type of an annotation-definition.
        Specified by:
        isAnnotationType in interface IReferenceType
        Returns:
        true, if and only if, this object is the type of an annotation-definition.

      • isClassType

        boolean isClassType()
        This method determines whether this object is really the type of an class-definition.
        Specified by:
        isClassType in interface IReferenceType
        Returns:
        true, if and only if, this object is the type of an class-definition.

      • isEnumType

        boolean isEnumType()
        This method determines whether this object is really the type of an enum-definition.
        Specified by:
        isEnumType in interface IReferenceType
        Returns:
        true, if and only if, this object is the type of an enum-definition.

      • isInterfaceType

        boolean isInterfaceType()
        This method determines whether this object is really the type of an interface-definition.
        Specified by:
        isInterfaceType in interface IReferenceType
        Returns:

      • toClass

        java.lang.Class toClass()
        This method tries to return the java.lang.Class related to this type.
        Specified by:
        toClass in interface IReturnType
        Returns:
        the class-object representation of this type, if a class-object exists for this type; otherwise, return null.
